title: Calories in 20 Piece Chicken Nuggets
meta_description: Learn calories in 20 piece nuggets with full nutrition facts, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and easy tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Breaded, fried chicken nuggets, standard fast-food style (~16g each), no dipping sauce or sides.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, breading, cooking method, and ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 20 piece chicken nuggets provide ~1000 kcal and ~80 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one chicken nugget?
faqs.a: About 50 kcal per standard fried chicken nugget.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 20 piece nuggets?
faqs.a: Roughly 80 g of protein from 20 piece chicken nuggets.

faqs.q: Are chicken nuggets high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, 20 pieces can have up to 3000 mg sodium due to breading and seasoning.

faqs.q: How do baked nuggets compare in calories?
faqs.a: Baked versions are typically 15-20 kcal less per nugget than fried.

faqs.q: Do chicken nuggets have trans fats?
faqs.a: Some brands do; check for 0.1 g or less per nugget to minimize intake.
